text: Hi, is there any examples how to implement or use the transaction certificates?

<@U2PAN55V0> - what exactly do you mean?     If you take a look at the Node.js SDK for example, by default it actually leverages transaction certificates for signing transactions submitted to the fabric

Ok. I think that is what i'm looking for. Do you have the link? I'm quite new to hyperledger and I'm having a hard time to find my way in the documentation. All I found  was <https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tech/application-ACL/> and <https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/API/MemberServicesAPI/>
<@U2PAN55V0>, feel free to also ask direct questions. It will allow us to point you to the right sections in the docs, or so.
Also, since you have mentioned ACLs above, there is a nice "Authorizable Counter” example that shows some of the strong capabilities of TCerts (with attributes)… which are quite powerful.
Ok. That is what I'm looking for. At the moment I not understand how to use the Tcerts in collaboration with the invoke of query of chaincode.
Found the examples...  <@U11MANG9G>  thanks for the info.  Now I can go futher with my example.
<@U2PAN55V0>: Great. Give us a shout if you have any/some more questions. Welcome to Fabric.
